code.description: An error code that identifies the type of error that occurred.

details.description: Additional information that can help the caller understand or fix the issue.

message.description: A message that describes the error condition.

ErrorList.description: A list of error responses returned when a request is unsuccessful.

FeeDetail.description: The type of fee, fee amount, and other details.

FeeType.description: The type of fee charged to a seller.

FeeDetailList.description: A list of other fees that contribute to a given fee.

FeesEstimate.description: The total estimated fees for an item and a list of details.

TimeOfFeesEstimation.description: The time at which the fees were estimated. This defaults to the time the request is made.

FeesEstimateError.description: An unexpected error occurred during this operation.

Code.description: An error code that identifies the type of error that occurred.

Message.description: A message that describes the error condition.

Type.description: An error type, identifying either the receiver or the sender as the originator of the error.

FeesEstimateErrorDetail.description: Additional information that can help the caller understand or fix the issue.

FeesEstimateIdentifier.description: An item identifier, marketplace, time of request, and other details that identify an estimate.

IdType.description: The type of item identifier specified.

IsAmazonFulfilled.description: When true, the offer is fulfilled by Amazon.

SellerInputIdentifier.description: A unique identifier provided by the caller to track this request.

Identifier.description: A unique identifier provided by the caller to track this request.

IsAmazonFulfilled.description: When true, the offer is fulfilled by Amazon.

FeesEstimateResult.description: An item identifier and the estimated fees for the item.

Status.description: The status of the fee request. Possible values: Success, ClientError, ServiceError.

IncludedFeeDetail.description: The type of fee, fee amount, and other details.

FeeType.description: The type of fee charged to a seller.

IncludedFeeDetailList.description: A list of other fees that contribute to a given fee.

CurrencyCode.description: The currency code in ISO 4217 format.

OptionalFulfillmentProgram.description: An optional enrollment program for which to return the estimated fees when the offer is fulfilled by Amazon (IsAmazonFulfilled is set to true).

x-docgen-enum-table-extension.description: Returns the standard Amazon fulfillment fees for the offer. This is the default.
Returns the Small and Light fees for the offer. The FBA Small and Light program offers reduced fulfillment costs on qualified items.
Returns the cross-border European Fulfillment Network fees across EU countries for the offer.

PriceToEstimateFees.description: Price information for an item, used to estimate fees.

info.description: The Selling Partner API for Product Fees lets you programmatically retrieve estimated fees for a product. You can then account for those fees in your pricing.
info.title: Selling Partner API for Product Fees

post.description:
Returns the estimated fees for the item indicated by the specified Asin in the marketplace specified in the request body.

You can call getMyFeesEstimateForASIN for an item on behalf of a seller before the seller sets the item's price. They can then take estimated fees into account. With each product fees request, you must include an original identifier. This identifier is included in the fees estimate so you can correlate a fees estimate with the original request.

**Usage Plans:**

| Plan type | Rate (requests per second) | Burst |
| ---- | ---- | ---- |
|Default| 10 | 20 |
|Selling partner specific| Variable | Variable |

The x-amzn-RateLimit-Limit response header returns the usage plan rate limits that were applied to the requested operation. Rate limits for some selling partners will vary from the default rate and burst shown in the table above. For more information, see "Usage Plans and Rate Limits" in the Selling Partner API documentation.

parameters.description: The Amazon Standard Identification Number (ASIN) of the item.
parameters.name: Asin

400.description: Request has missing or invalid parameters and cannot be parsed.

401.description: The request's Authorization header is not formatted correctly or does not contain a valid token.

403.description: Indicates access to the resource is forbidden. Possible reasons include Access Denied, Unauthorized, Expired Token, or Invalid Signature.

404.description: The specified resource does not exist.

429.description: The frequency of requests was greater than allowed.

500.description: An unexpected condition occurred that prevented the server from fulfilling the request.

503.description: Temporary overloading or maintenance of the server.

post.description:
Returns the estimated fees for the item indicated by the specified seller SKU in the marketplace specified in the request body.

You can call getMyFeesEstimateForSKU for an item on behalf of a seller before the seller sets the item's price. They can then take estimated fees into account. With each fees estimate request, you must include an original identifier. This identifier is included in the fees estimate so you can correlate a fees estimate with the original request.

**Usage Plans:**

| Plan type | Rate (requests per second) | Burst |
| ---- | ---- | ---- |
|Default| 10 | 20 |
|Selling partner specific| Variable | Variable |

The x-amzn-RateLimit-Limit response header returns the usage plan rate limits that were applied to the requested operation. Rate limits for some selling partners will vary from the default rate and burst shown in the table above. For more information, see "Usage Plans and Rate Limits" in the Selling Partner API documentation.

parameters.description: Used to identify an item in the given marketplace. SellerSKU is qualified by the seller's SellerId, which is included with every operation that you submit.
parameters.name: SellerSKU

400.description: Request has missing or invalid parameters and cannot be parsed.

401.description: The request's Authorization header is not formatted correctly or does not contain a valid token.

403.description: Indicates access to the resource is forbidden. Possible reasons include Access Denied, Unauthorized, Expired Token, or Invalid Signature.

404.description: The specified resource does not exist.

429.description: The frequency of requests was greater than allowed.
